message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DM. 

This paper deals with polynomial threshold functions (PTFs), which are a fundamental concept in computational complexity theory and have applications in various areas of computer science such as learning theory, cryptography, and circuit complexity. The regularity lemma and low weight approximators are techniques commonly used in computational complexity theory and related areas. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper also involves concepts related to discrete mathematics (cs.DM), information theory (cs.IT), and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the regularity lemma has connections to graph theory and combinatorics, which are sub-fields of computer science that fall under cs.DS (Discrete Structures).
